aoop.asteroids.model

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple text message that should only be displayed a certain amount of time on the screen.
    It should fade in when starting display, and fade out afterwards.
    Instances of Message are passed from Server to Client just like all GameObjects, to keep players updated about what happens.

    Messages are used to display:
    ->Game-related information (winning, dying, restarting)
    ->Connection-related information. (joining, losing connection)
    Author:
    qqwy

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message(java.lang.String message)
      A constructor that displays a message for the default of 5 seconds.
      Message(java.lang.String message, long visibleTime)
      Creates a new Message with given `message` that will display `visibleTime` milliseconds.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        A message should only be marked for destruction after it has faded out.
        Returns:
        true if it is marked for destruction.

      • toString

        Using the principle of least surprise, this is the most logical name for a getter of the actual Message contents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Used to check if this message is already known in the Client-Side Messages list. A Message is the same as another message if both have the same `id`.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        id

      • getOpacity

        public float getOpacity()
        Depending on the current offset from the creationTime, fades in the message, displays it at full opacity, or fades it out. For the actual fading algorithm, see Message#easingInOut
        Returns:
        the opacity in (0.0-1.0) range
        See Also:
        easingInOut(float, float, float, float)

      • toJSON

        public org.json.simple.JSONArray toJSON()
        Returns:
        a JSONArray containing the important characteristics of this Message (the message, the creationTime, the visibleTime and the id)
        See Also:
        Message#fromJSON()

      • easingInOut

        public float easingInOut(float t,
                float b,
                float c,
                float d)
        A standard Robert Penner Easing Equation.
        The easing this function describes is a more-or-less quadratic-in-out easing.
        Parameters:
        t - The current time step, from the start of the animation (in the same unit as d)
        b - the beginning value of the property
        c - the change from the beginning value of the property
        d - the total time the animation should take (in the same unit as t)
        Returns:
        a number between 0-1
